answers.answer: Dear Dr Mark,I really would like to thank you for volunteering your time on this forum. I know I speak on behalf of many others. Just wante to tell you that you're greatly appreciated and we sincerely thank you for your time as you must be a busy person but still find the time to answer some of our questions. Thanks again!!!

I say "dittos" to Ar's appreciation. I actually almost posted to you about being a volunteer/moderater on here too, then saw the Med-Help request for you to do this.I realize we post with a lot of emotion at times and we also vent a little at times. Dr.s I realize must remain emotionally uninvolved and I for one understand that and hope others do too.We also understand, depending upon your schedule, that you can only advice posters, when time permits. Thank you in advance for those times you are able to reply.Sincerely,JimLow
Thanks DrMark!Just knowing someone might be able to give some advice can give patients some hope.

Dear Dr Mark,Thank you so much for volunteering your time.  know how busy doctors are.I am newly diagnosed with Graves and am freaked out. I have so many qiestions and there seems to be a lot of contradictory information out there which really confuses me. Its comforting to know some one who truly knows cares enough to jump on this crazy forum and answer our concerns. Thank you.
Doctor for taking the time to help Thyroid victims.  I am sure you will see a post or two from me.

question: Med Help International is very pleased to announce that beginning on September 19, 2005, Dr. Mark Lupo will be answering questions daily in our Thyroid Disorders Forum.Dr. Lupo is board certified in Internal Medicine and also in Endocrinology, Diabetes and Metabolism.  He is volunteering his time and expertise to answer two new questions each day in this forum.We are so grateful for his help and we know you will all join us in welcoming Dr. Lupo and letting him know how much he is appreciated!Med Help International
title: Mark Lupo, M.D. Joins Med Help!
